body:
Hello @WeissShahaf I imagine you've gotten it to start a few times (I feel I've seen you here a few times ;). Note, seems if it is taking a while, it's your GPU not being used properly, and CPU takes a while to show 100 iterations. You can change to 1 to check, but given test script runs, seems not a bug report for DLC.

It also seems you are working across two drives on your machine, which could perhaps cause issues:
```python
 'init_weights': 'H:\\anaconda3\\envs\\DLC2107\\lib\\site-packages\\deeplabcut\\pose_estimation_tensorflow\\models\\pretrained\\mobilenet_v2_1.0_224.ckpt',
.
.
.
 'project_path': 'E:\\DLC\\GL999-sw-2021-07-26',
```
gpu is allocating memory. but cuda usage is 0%

@WeissShahaf, is your dataset large? Before prefetching and training actually start, we parse the data from the pickle files in training-datasets, which may take a couple of minutes if you have many (many) frames.
@jeylau about a 120 frames in total, from 6 videos, original .avi files are 4k, but cropped in DLC
@WeissShahaf , you overwrote it to display every 100 iterations, but you can change to 1: `displayiters=100`

@MMathisLab, tried it. again nothing happens, waited 12 hours. also on another machine, running ubuntu 18.04, and a different network type. same thing. 

so i guess it's something with my data / project / config files

after trying further tries, there was something that worked: a regular resnet50.
any mobile or effieient net did not
are you cropping your frames using `cropandlabel`? these are massive/oddly shaped frames ... `crop: 1164, 3317, 115, 2391`

these are cropped using the gui crop tool when extracting.
cropping is done out of a 3000x4000 image. to exclude a resting cage outside the arena, which itself is within a bigger arena. see image attached.
![Figure_1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/45653608/127528160-04441372-9828-4c1f-a8a2-b987a7501143.png)

would it help to keep all dimensions devisable by 8?

What is the max_input_size variable set to in your pose_cfg.yaml file? The only time I have seen this scenario happen (training doesn't start but doesn't error) is when the size of the all of the frames are outside the bounds of min_input_size and max_input_size, so there is no valid training data. Either reduce global_scale, or increase max_input_size. But as @MMathisLab  mentioned, these are massive frames, you should use the cropimagesandlabels to crop them down to a more managable size (also a form of data augmentation).

@alexcwsmith @MMathisLab 
i'm guessing it's a tensorflow / cudnn issue. as the next line after
Starting training.... is
2021-07-30 14:45:35.534453: I tensorflow/stream_executor/platform/default/dso_loader.cc:53] Successfully opened dynamic library cudnn64_8.dll
2021-07-30 14:45:36.706342: I tensorflow/stream_executor/cuda/cuda_dnn.cc:359] Loaded cuDNN version 8201.
i had suspicions it something to do with dimensions not being divisible by 8. so I made a new project with the same crop, just rounded each value to the next 8 divisible value. 

The other thing that helped is reducing global_scale to <0.5 and increasing max_input to 3000 as you suggested
